page.title: 011000 YEARS IN HORLEY
page.content: { Horley}is in the Weald between the North and South Downs on the flood plain of the River Mole. Records tell of a church dated 1084 belonging to Chertsey Abbey. There is also evidence of a mill and settlement beside the river. In the 19th century Londoners travelled to the popular resort of Brighton, breaking their stagecoach journey at Horley, approx. half-way. In 1841 the railway opened and a dormitory town developed around the station about 1km from the original settlement. A dramatic change to the area began with the opening of Gatwick international airport in 1958 on the site of a small aerodrome and race course. The past 20 years have seen massive growth of the region providing housing for airport workers,plus facilities and services for airport users.
